name: percent

B1 for or out of every 100, shown by the symbol %: You got 20 percent of the answers right - that means one in every five. Only 40 per cent of people bothered to vote in the election.
used for showing how sure you are about something, or how likely or true something is, or how much you agree with someone : I'm 99.9 percent sure I'm right. There's a 20% chance of rain today. Patients who develop symptoms have only a 10 per cent chance of surviving. I agree with you 101 percent. one hundred percent
informal (also a hundred percent, hundred percent) completely; used for emphasizing what you are saying: I agree with you one hundred percent.
